Brain.FrontalLobe

Class Arrow

  • java.lang.Object
    • Brain.FrontalLobe.Arrow

  • public class Arrow
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an arrow displayed on the screen while playing "Flying Arrows"
    Version:
    5/15/2017
    Author:
    Reet

      • getOrientation

        public int getOrientation()
        Returns an integer representing the orientation of the arrow. If it returns 37, then the orientation is left. If it returns 38, then the orientation is up. If it returns 39, then the orientation is down. If it returns 40, then the orientation is down.
        Returns:
        integer representing orientation of arrow

      • move

        Parameters:
